channel.title: [508] Error connecting to server [508]
channel.description:
I just recently switched from 317 to 508 and now I'm having trouble getting people to log into my server, I port forwarded and set up a no-ip and it all works fine.
When my friend tries to log into my server (via my client that I sent him, that has the ip set up correctly, I think) it loads up perfectly fine to the login screen, but when he trys to log in it says error connecting to server. But I can log in perfectly fine and the source cmd says that I connected using the local Ip. (127.0.0.1) Also, whenever he does try to log in I get a message in my source cmd saying "Recieved connection from: *his IP*" but still he cannot log in.
If anyone could help or atleast try to help it would be highly appreciated :(

item.title: [508] Error connecting to server [508]
item.dc:creator: @Bronze15 Bronze15
item.description:
@Bronze15 wrote:

I just recently switched from 317 to 508 and now I’m having trouble getting people to log into my server, I port forwarded and set up a no-ip and it all works fine.

When my friend tries to log into my server (via my client that I sent him, that has the ip set up correctly, I think) it loads up perfectly fine to the login screen, but when he trys to log in it says error connecting to server.
But I can log in perfectly fine and the source cmd says that I connected using the local Ip. (127.0.0.1)
Also, whenever he does try to log in I get a message in my source cmd saying “Recieved connection from: his IP” but still he cannot log in.

If anyone could help or atleast try to help it would be highly appreciated
